result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M Mcclain

records.addlTxt:
1:03 PM Defendant Christopher M Mcclain appeared by video from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases 22CF128 and 22CM125 heard together.  Matter set for adj. INIT. PD has not been able to appoint an attorney at this point.   Court adjourned matter to 1/11/23 at 1:30 PM.    In case 22CM125:  Court ordered a $1000 signature bond with conditions of absolute sobriety and do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid operating privilege.  Adj. 1:05 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 11, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
OSPD report. To date 18 attempts have been made to obtain counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Absolute sobriety, no operation of MV w/o a valid DL.

 State requests a sign bond, absolute sobriety, no operation of MV w/o a valid DL.  Court will order a $2500.00 sign bond with the conditions requested. Adj 1:32pm
